body.p: Born January 18, 1816 in Claiborne, Maryland. Graduated from West Point in 1836. Became a Railroad Construction Engineer. Moved to Paducah, Kentucky in 1852. Commissioned Colonel of the 3rd Kentucky Infantry (CSA) on July 5, 1861. Promoted to Brigadier General on October 18, 1861. Commanded the construction of forts Donaldson and Henry in Tennessee. Surrendered to General Grant at Fort Henry on February 6, 1862. Imprisoned at Fort Warren in Boston, Massachusetts. Exchanged and released on August 15, 1862. Commissioned as Brigade Commander in Earl Van Dornâ€™s Army of the West. Died on May 16, 1863 when he was hit by a shell fragment at the Battle of Champion Hill.
